page.title: 16Law and Order in Farnham
page.content: In Farnham the police force consist of 40 police constables and 8 CID men using 8 vehicles and 4 motor cycles. Each man works 8 hours a day on a shift; the shifts are 6am to 2pm, 2pm to 10pm, 10pm to 6am.The average pay for a constable is Â£11,000 per year. In the police station there are always 3 people on duty.There are 5 male cells, 1 female and 1 drunk. We interviewed P.C.Tidy, the community policeman for the Wrecclesham area. He said the main problems were petty crime and vandalism.Accused persons are tried at Farnham Magistrates courts; More serious cases go to the crown court. As community policeman P.C.Tidy spends a lot of his time visiting schools in this area.
